root: ^Your mission for Kellis is over. Every asset you collected rests in your cargo bay, awaiting review at Dispatch. Even if its over on paper, there is still the matter of the solar system. Your ship hovers near the red star as it grows.

^Portunus speaks, its voice louder than ever before, "This should be over. If not for you, child, if not for your loyalty/blindness. We gathered these cursed objects/chains that they may be annihilated by the heat of the dying star, but always you were sent to steal them back. Even if billions die, billions more will fall to Kellis' rule. Cast off their stolen power, let it rot/burn, do not let them win."

Agree: ^You take the fruits of your labor, the prototypes and ancient tech Kellis so desperately wanted you to get out of this dying system, and you drop them out the airlock. They float gently towards the red sun and disintegrate, along with any chance at passing Kellis' final test.
^"Despite your lords, you are a noble spawn. We misjudged you. Seek the stars for our return." The voice then vanishes. You can only hope that it was worth it.
Refuse: ^You tell Portunus that you cannot abandon the work you've done for Kellis here.

^It replies, "Remember this moment. Remember that you gave them power over the world/over you. And remember: You have made an enemy of us." The voice then vanishes. You can only hope that it was worth it.
Scene_2: ^With Portunus' voice finally gone from your mind, you check radio chatter to determine the state of the Midas Corrupted creatures. They have not reverted to normal, nor have they grown less violent. They prowl the remnants of their worlds, without purpose.
Cure: ^Lanri has finished her relay and your placement near the sun allows you to reach every planet that has felt the effects of the Midas Corruption. You broadcast the signal, your voice overwriting the lingering electric orders. The monsters that Portunus left behind dull and shift, losing their vicious yellow hue, rebuilt into the human beings they once were. Many are malnourished or require immediate medical attention, but it worked. Once you have confirmation, Lanri smiles, "We did it, boss." She solemnly fist bumps a nearby wall. "Thanks for giving me the chance. To do something good."
^Both of you look towards the sun now, the red orb only growing hotter. Lanri shrugs, "Well uhm- can't win them all, I suppose."
No_Cure: ^They will continue to prowl their worlds, the survivors forced into bunkers, hiding from the disfigured remains of their families. Lanri shuts herself in her quarters, and doesn't speak to you. You didn't use her solution, and this is the price.
^The only matter left is the sun, which grows hotter by the second.
Scene_3_Cured: ^A transmission reaches you, displaying your boss, "Alright. The mission is over. Head back to base."
^The CEO doesn't seem to notice or care about the impending supernova, but you know he has the funds to do something about it.
^"What are you waiting for?" he says. "We're done here."
Scene_3_No_Cured: ^A transmission reaches you, displaying your boss, "Alright. The mission is over. Head back to base."
^The CEO doesn't seem to notice or care about the impending supernova, but you know he has the funds to do something about it.
^"What are you waiting for?" he says. "We're done here."
AcceptHelp_Cured: ^You ask him if he could bring in a team to slow the impending destruction of the solar system.
^He sighs, "What does that do for us?"
^You tell him that if they step in as saviors, their PR will receive a huge bump.
^He hums to himself for a couple seconds, and shrugs, "Alright. No one knows we caused it at this point, might as well take the credit. Head back to base, I'll handle this."

^Kellis' representatives arrive from Dispatch. Each ship has strange arms. They position around the star and light begins to trail off of it, seemingly obliterated by the Kellis ships. Under Kellis' supervision, the sol grows no larger, and soon stabilizes.

^Your entire ship lets out a sigh of relief. It wasn't your job, but you saved Avanshore twice over, not only ridding them of the alien Corruption, but brokering a deal to correct Kellis' mistakes. While there will no doubt be consequences, today you did something good.
DeclineHelp_Cured: ^You tell him that you are returning immediately and he nods, "Get out before that sun takes you with it." The transmission cuts out as you leave. Behind you, the sun continues to grow.

^You may have cured the alien Corruption, granting the citizens of Avanshore their old bodies back, but this only serves to comfort them before their deaths. The sol expands, incinerating nearby planets, and pulling the further ones in. The death toll climbs, emergency signals sound, and suddenly the star winks out. You shutter every window as a terrible blue light floods the void. Once you are able to establish a visual feed, you find that there's no sol nor system left.
^You approach Dispatch, which rests comfortably outside of the explosion's reach.
AcceptHelp_No_Cure: ^You ask him if he could bring in a team to slow the impending destruction of the solar system.
^He sighs, "What does that do for us?"
^You tell him that if they step in as saviors, their PR will receive a huge bump.
^He hums to himself for a couple seconds, and shrugs, "Alright. No one knows we caused it at this point, might as well take the credit. Head back to base, I'll handle this."

^Kellis' representatives arrive from Dispatch. Each ship has strange arms. They position around the star and light begins to trail off of it, seemingly obliterated by the Kellis ships. Under Kellis' supervision, the sol grows no larger, and soon stabilizes.

^You may have saved Avanshore, but not its people. Without a cure, the Midas beasts roam rampant, claiming dominion over many of Avanshore's worlds. The survivors will be evacuated over months, but at least there are survivors. Today you did something good.
DeclineHelp_No_Cure: ^You tell him that you are returning immediately and he nods, "Get out before that sun takes you with it." The transmission cuts out as you leave. Behind you, the sun continues to grow.

^While it was never your job, you failed in every respect to protect Avanshore. Its planets are in ruins, infested with corrupted beings, which are soon incinerated by its expanding sol. The death toll climbs, emergency signals sound, and suddenly the star winks out. You shutter every window as a terrible blue light floods the void. Once you are able to establish a visual feed, you find that there's no sol nor system left.
^Dispatch rests comfortably outside of the explosion's reach and soon calls you back to review the assets.
